Key Match Events: The Pacers had a 17-2 second quarter run that turned a 30-29 deficit into a 46-31 lead.
The Warriors never led again but cut the halftime deficit to five and closed within three early in the third quarter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors sat six players on their second game in two nights, including All-Star Stephen Curry, Draymond Green and Andrew Wiggins.
Others: Indiana took control with a 17-2 second quarter run
Golden State was led by former Pacers star Buddy Hield who had 17 points.
Pat Spencer scored a season high 17 for the Warriors.
Indiana has won all five games by 10 or more points
Haliburton has rediscovered his All-Star level
Indiana has won its fifth straight to match its longest streak of the season
The Pacers had an answer every time Golden State got close
The Pacers struggled to score in the paint in the first half, but finished the game with a 54-46 scoring advantage inside
